newsitem.title: USA: Ziff-Davis Consumer acquires assets of Videogames.
newsitem.headline: Ziff-Davis Consumer acquires assets of Videogames.

text.p: Ziff-Davis Consumer Media Group said on Wednesday it had acquired assets of Videogames magazine from LFP Inc, including its list of subscribers.

Videogames, a monthly magazine founded in 1993, will cease publication from its September 1996 issue while subscriptions for Videogames will be fulfilled by Electronic Gaming Monthly, published by Ziff-Davis.
Videogames had an average paid circulation of 118,219, according to its December 1995 publisher's statement. Ziff Davis publishes computer magazines for the business and Internet market.
Terms of the deal were not disclosed.
